current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prevent the extension of the tax collection period
			 merely because the taxpayer is a member of the Armed Forces who is
			 hospitalized as a result of combat zone injuries.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Wounded Warrior Tax Equity Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Wounded Warrior Tax Equity Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prevention of
			 extension of tax collection period for members of the Armed Forces who are
			 hospitalized as a result of combat zone injuries

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following
			 new paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 7508(e) of
			 the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
With respect to any period of continuous
				qualified hospitalization described in subsection (a) and the next
			 180 days
				thereafter, subsection (a) shall not apply in the application of

header.#text:
Collection
				period after assessment not extended as a result of
				hospitalization

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxes
			 assessed before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2686 IS: Wounded Warrior Tax Equity Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
